name: Mezcal Paloma
author: France C
summary: A paloma is traditionally made with tequila, grapefruit juice, and lime, but this version uses mezcal instead of tequila for a nice smoky twist! The smoke flavor is due to the underground ovens filled with volcanic rock, coal and wood that are used to cook the agave to produce the mezcal. I like to rim the glass with coarse smoked salt or black salt, but feel free to use regular kosher salt.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon kosher salt, or as needed
directions: Rub the cut side of a lime wedge around the edge of the glass
Place salt on a plate and invert glass into salt to rim the glass
Squeeze juice from the same lime wedge into the glass
Pour mezcal over ice, then top with grapefruit soda
